results.overview: When Ruby and Rhett's parents are killed in a car accident, their carefree teenage lives are suddenly shattered. Moving to an incredible house in Malibu with the Glasses', old friends of the family, seems to be the beginning of a new life for them.
results.title: The Glass House

results.overview: Adapted from a story by Truman Capote ("In Cold Blood"), the world of the prison convict is open to the viewer. As the story develops, one thing becomes clear. As in the outside world, there is a "system"; and just as on the outside, there is accommodation, honesty, cynicism, violence and all the other factors that make up our society. The film follows the three newcomers, it records the grim, terrifying, sometimes fascinating events that occur.
results.title: The Glass House

results.overview: The fringes of Iranian society can be a lonely place, especially if you are a teenage girl with few resources to fall back on. Finding Home follows four girls striving to pull themselves out of the margins by attending a one-of-kind rehabilitation center in uptown Tehran. Forget about the Iran that you've seen before. With a virtually invisible camera, the girls of Finding Home take us on a never-before-seen tour of the underclass of Iran with their brave and defiant stories: Samira struggles to overcome forced drug addiction; Mitra harnesses abandonment into her creative writing; Sussan teeters on a dangerous ledge after years of sexual abuse; and Nazila burgeons out of her hatred with her blazing rap music.
results.title: The Glass House

results.overview: Tool Live 1996 The Glass House. Remastered.  Pomona, CA  October 16th, 1996.  Edited & remastered by ToolArchive.
results.title: Tool Live The Glass House  1996

results.original_title: Tsunami Bomb: The Show Must Go Off! - Live at the Glass House
results.overview: Who knew a sleepy Northern California town like Petaluma could produce a punk band of raucous and electrifying proportions? But that's exactly how the aptly named Tsunami Bomb -- which sold thousands of copies of its EP, "The Invasion from Within" -- is characterized. Fans who have yet to catch the band at work (and play) can do so with this astounding concert video that features their live show in Pomona, Calif.
results.title: Tsunami Bomb: The Show Must Go Off! - Live at the Glass House

results.overview: A story about a life of a group of children in the foster home.
results.title: The Glass House

results.overview: A portrait of two men with Asperger Syndrome, who give us insights into their inner world throughself-written poetry and stories, thus relativizing both the concept of normality and any autism stereotypes.  What does your inner world look like? What rooms do you flee to when the outside world is unbearable? How does this world smell? Does it smell like traces of human scent? How do you connect your inner world with the outer world? A documentary not only about those who ask themselves these questions every day. A film not only about autism spectrum disorder or Asperger's syndrome but about all of us.
results.title: In the Glass House

results.overview: A story of two boys told through a dragonfly specimen.  Is the story told from the boy’s side?  Or is this a dragonfly’s dream?
results.title: 2 PM at the Glass House

results.overview: An exploration of Soviet director Sergei Eisenstein's notes and drawings for a science fiction movie that he pitched to Paramount in 1930 about the residents of a skyscraper with walls and floors of clear glass.
results.title: Glass House

results.overview: One year after losing their son David, Eve Goode and her husband Raymond Goode adopt the orphan Ethan Snow (and his teenager sister Abby Snow and bring them to their mansion nearby a lake. Abby faces difficulties of adaptation in her new home, and she confronts Eve, who proves to be deranged and unstable. When Ethan gets sick, Abby tries to contact their friend, detective Ben Koch, and she realizes that her brother and she are trapped in the house.
results.title: Glass House: The Good Mother
